title: 2011년 Doss 사건
summary: 미국 USA, Federal 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: Doss. 판결일: 2011-01-14. 법원: Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Juan Rico DOSS, Defendant-Appellant
**판결일**: 2011-01-14
**법원**: Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit
**관할**: USA, Federal

**판사**: Michael Daly Hawkins, Marsha S. Berzon and Richard R. Clifton, Circuit Judges

## 변호인

Davina T. Chen (briefed and argued), Office of the Federal Public Defender, Los Angeles, CA, for the defendant-appellant., Anne Voigts (argued) and Tammy C. Spertus (briefed), Office of the United States Attorney, Los Angeles, CA, for the plaintiff-appellee.

## 인용

- 630 F.3d 1181

## 판결문 요약


630 F.3d 1181 (2011)
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee,
v.
Juan Rico DOSS, Defendant-Appellant.
No. 07-50334.
United States Court of Appeals, Ninth Circuit.
Argued and Submitted March 9, 2009.
Submission Vacated March 24, 2009.
Resubmitted August 20, 2009.
Submission Vacated January 4, 2010.
Resubmitted December 1, 2010.
Filed January 14, 2011.
*1183 Davina T. Chen (briefed and argued), Office of the Federal Public Defender, Los Angeles, CA, for the defendant-appellant.
Anne Voigts (argued) and Tammy C. Spertus (briefed), Office of the United States Attorney, Los Angeles, CA, for the plaintiff-appellee.
Before: MICHAEL DALY HAWKINS, MARSHA S. BERZON and RICHARD R. CLIFTON, Circuit Judges.

OPINION
HAWKINS, Circuit Judge:
Juan Rico Doss ("Doss") appeals his conviction and life sentence for sex trafficking of children, transportation of minors into prostitution, conspiracy to commit those offenses, and two counts of witness tampering. The issue before us is whether one can be convicted for witness tampering under 18 U.S.C. § 1512 by encouraging a witness to withhold testimony when that witness possesses a legal right or privilege not to testify. Doss also contends that the district court erred in applying Taylor's[1] modified categorical approach to find he had a qualifying prior sex offense involving a child under the age of 17, thus requiring a life sentence pursuant to 18 U.S.C. § 3559(e). For the reasons that follow, we largely affirm, but the reversal of one co...
